Dear Yulonda W Shell:
Attached is the Amended Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility.
Due to the violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required.
The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately please contact the area manager, Rorie Dodge-Pifer at (517) 899-6024.

Investigation Interviews:
On 12/17/2024 an in-person interview was completed with Youth

Another meeting was held with Youth A on 12/19/2024 along with
DHHS Specialist. Youth A was participating in a leadership
conference on the campus of Vista Maria and requested that we
allow her to continue and schedule a different time to interview

concerns.
A final in-person meeting was held with Youth A at Vista Maria on

received restrictions based on her behavior earlier that day.
Youth A also reported that Staff 1 was making statements to her

Another meeting was held with Compliance on 12/19/2024 with

On 12/19/2024 and in-person meeting with Complainant was
held. No additional concerns were reported.
On 12/19/2024 a voice message was left for FCW requesting a
return call with any concerns.
On 12/23/2024 an in-person interview was completed with Staff 2

that on the day of the incident she was getting tape for one of the
other wings and noticed Staff 1 and Youth A in the hallway. She
denied knowledge of how long the two of them had been in the

with Youth A and he could leave the area. However, she reported

pushed Youth A to the wall. She indicated this is not an approved
restraint technique to restrain against a wall. She also reported

redirect her by telling her to go to her wing. Staff 2 denied that she
has seen Staff 1 use inappropriate restraint techniques with other

Staff 1 was interviewed, and stated Youth A was mad because

An interview was completed with Youth B and Youth C. They

Vista Maria Behavior Management Policy – To maintain a safe
environment for all Vista Maria clients and staff, behavior
management interventions are only used when a client presents a
danger to self or others. These interventions should only be used
when all other less restrictive behavior management interventions
(i.e., verbal de-escalation, therapeutic interventions) have been
explored. To prevent the need for behavior management
interventions, Vista Maria staff serve as role models to our clients
by building and maintaining a therapeutic alliance and
strengthening youth self-capacities. Vista Maria staff will
continuously provide a safe, supportive, and nurturing
environment in which each client can learn and practice coping
and de-escalation mechanisms that work best for each individual.
Physical/Safety Interventions. Physical or safety intervention
techniques will be utilized as an absolute last resort.
Staff are only permitted to utilize approved behavior management
techniques as taught by a certified Crisis Prevention Institute
trainer.
Medical Report for Youth A – Youth A was seen for pain to her

Youth stated that her right elbow was hit after becoming

able to raise her arm at full height and flex elbow. Youth A was
given Tylenol for pain and an ice pack.
Tour of Agency/Restraint Location
A walk through of the unit was completed and there were no areas
of concern noted.
Analysis At the conclusion of the investigation, the agency was found to be
in non-compliance with licensing rule 4159-5. Both staff and youth
were interviewed as a part of this investigation and review of video
footage also took place. Staff 1 failed to follow proper CPI
technique as he was seen putting Youth A up against the wall.

Vista Maria Employee Behavior Policy – The purpose of the

Analysis At the conclusion of the investigation, the agency was found to be

Conclusion Violation Not Established
